data.Description:
Initiating of any personnel action by the Requesting Office (RO) that is intended to create or modify an employee's record. The Personnel Action Request includes initiating, routing and approving through the agency's designated route controls and approval prior to processing the action (e.g. budget, classification, etc.). Service Outcomes include but are not limited to
  • Providing a streamlined PAR workflow
  • Personnel Action SF50 is generated to the eOPF/OPF
  • Outcomes will be action applied based on processing system (e.g., match, mismatch or suspense inquiry system (SINQ) errors, etc.)
  • Fully executed and legally sufficient SF52 Request for Personnel Action

Coding, adjudicating (quality review), and approval from the Servicing Personnel Office (SPO) to include inputting of request and supporting documentation into an HR system, that are intended to create or modify an employee's record. Service Outcomes include but are not limited to
  • Gives final approval of action to create the SF50
  • Fully approved, executed and legally compliant SF50
  • Accurate and timely compensation (or employee records) based on the SF50

Maintaining and managing personnel action request records and supporting documentation. Updating Official Personnel Folder with fully executed, legally sufficient, and approved SF50s, in accordance with the Guide to Personnel Recordkeeping (GPR). Generating and/or requesting managerial and organizational status reports and notifications. Service Outcomes Include but are not limited to
  • Creating the employees official federal service of record.
  • Timely and accurate documentation and reporting of PAR Processing Activity.
  • SF50s are automatically generated upon the successful processing of an action.
